articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighter
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Fighter
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Kim Chol Man, an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter who greeted his 95th birthday.
					 Born in a tenant family in Unhung County, Ryanggang Province on Nov. 2, Juche 9 (1920), Kim Chol Man joined the juvenile company of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and grew up to be a proud member of the KPRA under the care of President Kim Il Sung and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and thus made a positive contribution to accomplishing the cause of national liberation.
					
					 He performed heroic feats in battles fought against the U.S. imperialist aggressors during the past Fatherland Liberation War. In the post-war period, too, he protected the Party and the leader, tightly holding the arms of revolution.
					
					 The President and leader Kim Jong Il made sure that he was awarded Party and state commendations including Order of Kim Il Sung, Title of Twice Hero of the Republic, Title of Labor Hero and watches bearing the august name of the President. This added shine to his life.
					
					 Carrying forward the loving care of the great leaders, Kim Jong Un saw to it that Kim Chol Man was awarded Order of Kim Jong Il and a watch bearing his august name.
					
					 The birthday spread was handed to Kim Chol Man on Monday.

articles.title: Meeting Marks 70th Anniversary of Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Meeting Marks 70th Anniversary of Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place at the People's Palace of Culture Monday to mark the 70th anniversary of Rodong Sinmun.
					 Seven decades ago President Kim Il Sung founded the Workers' Party of Korea and established Jongro, predecessor of Rodong Sinmun, without delay. 
					
					 The President showed deep loving care and trust for the party newspaper so that it might dynamically wage an ideological and media campaign from its inception. 
					
					 The party newspaper greeted the heyday of its development under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He wisely led Rodong Sinmun to creditably perform its mission and role as a good educator, a dynamic information worker and faithful mouthpiece in carrying out the revolutionary cause of the party at all times.
					
					 Present at the meeting were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, officials, journalists and editors in the field of media, merited persons, active worker-farmer writers and members of a delegation of the Choson Sinbo Company of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan staying in the socialist homeland.
					
					 Ri Yong Sik, editor-in-chief of Rodong Sinmun, said that the founding of Rodong Sinmun helped the WPK have mighty ideological vanguard for training all party members and other working people as staunch revolutionaries of Juche type and dynamically promoting the Korean revolution and the cause of human independence under the banner of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					 The reporter recalled that under the care of the great leaders and Marshal Kim Jong Un the officials, journalists, editors and employees of the newspaper have creditably performed the mission and duty they assumed before the times and the revolution.
					
					 The reporter called on all the officials, journalists and e editors to dynamically wield the pens of the revolution and successfully fulfill their honorable mission as ideological standard-bearers in carrying out the revolutionary cause of Juche, rallied close around the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Congratulations to Guinean President-Reelect
articles.content:
Congratulations to Guinean President-Reelect
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, in a message Sunday congratulated President-reelect Alpha Conde of the Republic of Guinea.
					 The message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative bilateral relations with long history and tradition would as ever favorably develop, wishing the Guinean president good health and happiness and success in his work for political stability and economic prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Delegation of Youth League Leaves for Cuba, Venezuela
articles.content:
Delegation of Youth League Leaves for Cuba, Venezuela
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League led by Jong Yong Won, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here Monday to take part in the 19th Congress of the World Federation of Democratic Youth to be held in Cuba and to visit Venezuela.

articles.title: Youth League Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
Youth League Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League led by Vice-Chairman of its Central Committee Ri Hyon Min came back home on Monday after visiting the Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation.

articles.title: Sojourn of Singaporean Delegation
articles.content:
Sojourn of Singaporean Delegation
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Singapore Council of Women's Organizations led by President Malathi Das visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and the patriotic life of his family members, they looked round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae with much care.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, International Friendship Exhibition House, Okryu Children's Hospital, Kyongsang Kindergarten, Pyongyang Baby Home and Orphanage, etc.

articles.title: French Business People Delegation Here
articles.content:
French Business People Delegation Here
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of French business people led by Alban Yung, Chinese representative of the "Foundation of Victor Segalen" in France, arrived here Monday.

articles.title: Iranian Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Iranian Delegation Leaves
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Iranian Workers' House led by General Secretary Alireza Mahgoub left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: National Heritage Protection Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
National Heritage Protection Brisk in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- It is one year since Kim Jong Un,  supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, made public his work "To Protect National Heritage Is a Patriotic Undertaking for Adding Brilliance to the History and Traditions of Our Nation".
					 In the period a radical turn has been brought about in the work to protect the national heritage in the country, Ro Chol Su, deputy director of the National Authority for the Protection of Cultural Heritage, told KCNA.
					
					 In cooperation with scientific and educational institutions, the National Authority for the Protection of Cultural Heritage has discovered and registered many cultural heritages as well as intangible and natural heritages, he said, adding:
					
					 A brisk drive was launched to put national heritages on the list of world's heritages.
					
					 A lot of national heritages were restored to their original state, including Ryongwang Pavilion and Songbul, Kaesim and Sokwang temples.
					
					 Also a work was conducted to register swinging, archery, yut-game, Korean painting and other objects as intangible heritages.
					
					 As part of a campaign for protecting national heritages, such diverse events took place throughout the country as peasant dancing contest, national ssirum contest, cooking festival, Korean dress exhibition and folk games.
					
					 Mt. Myohyang took on new looks with more than 20 pavilions repaired and mountain-climbing route extending some 2 500 square meters newly paved, while more scenic spots were found in Mt. Chilbo.
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of trees were planted in scenic spots across the country.
					
					 The Pyongyang Folklore Park renewed its appearance and history museums in local areas were renovated in a peculiar style.

articles.title: DPRK Players Successful at Artistic Gymnastics World Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Players Successful at Artistic Gymnastics World Championships
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK player Ri Se Gwang placed first at the men's vault event of the 46th Artistic Gymnastics World Championships held in UK from Oct. 23.
					 It brought together 593 men and women players of 87 countries including the DPRK, China, Russia, Germany, Japan and the U.S.
					
					 He grabbed a gold medal by trouncing his Romanian and U.S. rivals.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK player Hong Un Jong won a silver medal at the women's vault event of the championships.

articles.title: Wind-driven Generators on Upgrade
articles.content:
Wind-driven Generators on Upgrade
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Taean Electric Appliances Factory under the Taean Heavy Machine Complex in the DPRK has steadily upgraded the production of different wind-driven generators.
					 Recently, the factory completed a production process of 10 kw-generator, said Kim Il Gyong, chief engineer of the factory.
					
					 The factory succeeded in producing 0.3 kw-generator based on permanent magnet and installed over 100 units of its kind in villages of Unchon County, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 It is also manufacturing 1 kw-generator of high-quality.

articles.title: New Waterproof Paint Developed
articles.content:
New Waterproof Paint Developed
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- New waterproof paint was developed by the Road Construction Trading Company in the DPRK.
					 The milk-white paint, made with locally available materials, proves more effective and economic than existing ones. 
					
					 It can be coated on different materials such as concrete, iron plate and urethane gum, as it is good in coefficient of elongation, flexibility, impermeability, acid endurance and elasticity.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Faith
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Revolutionary Faith
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Korean revolution is the cause full of great idea and rare faith, says an editorial article of Rodong Sinmun Monday.
					 "Don't abandon revolutionary faith though one may die". This slogan reflects the truth which has invariably prevailed in the Korean revolution for nearly one century and is a secret to eternal victory, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The path of revolution should be covered with faith.
					
					 The revolutionary faith is dearer than one's own life and it is inviolable and strong as it can never be bartered for anything. This is the transparent creed of the Korean revolutionaries who never abandon the revolutionary faith though they may die.
					
					 The revolutionary faith of the Korean people is the ideological spirit in which they closely link their destiny with the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK are a large contingent of those who fight to the last along the road of the revolution, firmly convinced of the validity of their revolutionary cause started in Mt. Paektu and of their one's own strength and future.
					
					 It is the valuable truth which the Korean revolutionaries enshrined at the cost of blood that the revolutionary faith guarantees victory and makes one's life glorious. In the course of remaining true to revolutionary faith at the cost of their lives the Korean revolutionaries underwent unspeakable difficulties and trials but they won all the victories and met glory regarded hardly achievable in the nation's history spanning five thousand years.
					
					 The revolutionary faith is the undying soul of the Korean revolutionaries and a valuable treasure of the Juche revolution.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will certainly bring earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, while deeply trusting and following Marshal Kim Jong Un, the sun of the revolution, just like ever-green pine tree, pure white germ and undying bamboo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces Japan for Denying Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces Japan for Denying Its Past Crimes
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The society for settlement of the issue of "comfort women" made up of Japanese women's organizations recently urged Prime Minister Abe to take the earliest possible measures for settling the issue of "comfort women," saying Japan may miss the opportunity of making apology for it for good unless an urgent measure is taken as the survivors are at their advanced ages.
					 A ceremony of marking the 5th anniversary of the erection of the monument to "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army took place in New Jersey State, the U.S., timed to coincide with the ever-growing voices critical of Japan's attitude toward the Japanese imperialists' crimes during the Second World War in the UN arena.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary says this is a strong message to the Japanese reactionaries persistently embellishing the history of aggression of the Japanese imperialists and their crimes against humanity.
					
					 Japan is making desperate efforts to cover up its past hideous crimes including drafting of a large number of women as sexual slaves, far from making an apology for them.
					
					 Lurking behind such moves is a criminal intention to repeat those crimes.
					
					 Japan enacted "security legislation" despite the unanimous rebuff and denunciation by the public at home and abroad. This proves what phase they have reached in their hegemonic ambition to realize the old militarist dream which they pursued to dominate the world while trumpeting about "peace in the East".
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is the primary target of the Japanese reactionaries' overseas aggression.
					
					 Japan tries hard to launch without hesitation aggression against the DPRK in collusion with the U.S. under the signboard of exercising the "right to collective self-defence" in a bid to realize the old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere".
					
					 Japan will suffer only destruction if it keeps rushing headlong into militarization and reinvasion while embellishing its past crimes, far from sincerely drawing a lesson from its past history.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for History Distorting
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for History Distorting
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- University professors, researchers and other intellectuals of south Korea are opposing the authorities' moves to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks". 
					 History professors of Yonsei University refused to write "state-compiled history textbooks" on October 13 to be followed by 454 history professors of 70 universities of south Korea till October 23. Most of them are professors of Seoul National University, Yonsei University, Korea University and other major universities. 
					
					 88 university professors in Pusan, Ulsan and South Kyongsang Province signed the declaration of denying it on October 23. 
					
					 Veteran historians, and teachers and new teachers and researchers held a press conference in Seoul on October 24 at which they denounced the "government" and the ruling party for staging a history coup. Then they marched as far as Kwanghwamun. 
					
					 On October 27 history professors of the "National History Institute of south Korea" said in a statement that the authorities' moves to  introduce "state-compiled history textbooks" is little short of a declaration of their intention to maintain power by distorting history as they please.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Urged to Step down
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Urged to Step down
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- 23 labor and citizens organizations in North Jolla Province, south Korea held a rally in Jonju City, North Jolla Province on Oct. 30 at which they urged the undemocratic regime to step down.
					 In a resolution the organizations branded the regime as the undemocratic regime against workers, peasants and common people as it is keen on making the majority of people poor and bringing profits to a handful of plutocrats.
					
					 They demanded the regime step down at once as it turned south Korea into a dark society without hope and future.
					
					 They condemned the regime and the ruling party for reducing all workers to part-time workers by retrogressively revising the labor law including easy lay-off and low wage and for pushing agriculture to a crisis and peasants to cliff through reckless market opening.
					
					 They said that people from all walks of life in the province would launch the Nov. 14 people's action.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Launch Campaign against Regime's Distortion of History
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Launch Campaign against Regime's Distortion of History
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- South Korean students launched a campaign for issuing a declaration on the situation in protest against the regime's moves to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks" in a bid to revive "yusin" dictatorship.
					 Speakers of the Korea University Network for Checking Introduction of "State-Compiled History Textbooks" at their kick-off ceremony held on Oct. 30 at the university blamed the regime for producing "state-compiled textbooks" after forming a group of writers in secrecy. This is aimed at reviving "yusin" contrary to the trend of times, they added.
					
					 7,000 students of the university took part in the campaign.
					
					 Postgraduates and graduates of the university issued a statement denouncing the regime's distortion of history.
					
					 At least 2,540 students of Choongang University signed the declaration on the situation in protest against the regime's introduction of "state-compiled history textbooks."
					
					 On Oct. 29, the Choongang University Network for Checking Introduction of "State-compiled History Textbooks" held a press conference at the university at which it declared that its students were opposed to the regime's moves.
					
					 On the same day the Seoul University Network for Checking Introduction of "State-compiled History Textbooks" held a meeting at the university and released a declaration on the situation.
					
					 Speakers warned that they would launch an all-out campaign against the regime in case it fails to retract its plan to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks."

articles.title: Bird Flu Breaks out in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bird Flu Breaks out in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- Bird flu occurred one after another in Ryongam County, South Jolla Province, south Korea, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 Ducks infected with bird flu were detected in two farmhouses around a duck farm in the county in which bird flu was witnessed on October 18.
					
					 Bird flu is rapidly spreading in Raju, Kangjin, Ryongam and other places of South Jolla Province.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Guinea
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Guinea
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" was held by the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea on October 26 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of its publication.
					 A reading session on the work was followed by speeches there.
					
					 Camano Vitor, chairman of the group, said:
					
					 H.E. Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" is a historical document as it defended the scientific accuracy and truth of socialism and clearly proved its tremendous vitality.
					
					 The justice of the work was clearly proved by the reality of the DPRK dynamically advancing along the road of socialism despite the U.S. and other hostile forces' moves to stifle it.
					
					 Socialism in the DPRK is the most scientific and it has invincible might.
					
					 Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism serves as guidelines clearly indicating the road to be followed by progressive mankind.
					
					 H.E. Kim Jong Un is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The advantages of socialism are now being fully displayed in the DPRK, a shining fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We will widely introduce the reality of the DPRK and the advantages of socialism to the Guinean people and conduct more brisk activities to study and disseminate Kim Jong Il's famous work.

articles.title: Anniversary of Publication of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed by Guinean Organization
articles.content:
Anniversary of Publication of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed by Guinean Organization
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued an information bulletin on October 27 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of the publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science".
					 The bulletin recalled that Kim Jong Il published a highly important work indicating the road of new surge of the socialist movement and its sure victory late in the last century when the ideological confusion and vacillation occurred among many people due to the collapse of socialism in the East European countries one after another. It noted:
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his work taught that the collapse of socialism in various countries did not mean the failure of socialism as a science but the bankruptcy of opportunism which rendered socialism degenerated.
					
					 And he clearly indicated the essential advantages of Korean style socialism demonstrating its might as a socialist fortress and specified ways of successfully building socialism.
					
					 He declared that man-centred socialism, socialism centred on the popular masses, is sure to triumph for its scientific accuracy and truth.
					
					 The reality shows how nonsensical the "complete end of socialism" touted by the imperialists and their mouthpieces is and , at the same time, proves that socialism is a science and truth and it is the inexorable law of history that mankind is heading for socialism.
					
					 Socialism is a science and sure to triumph.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Urges U.S. to Respond to DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Urges U.S. to Respond to DPRK's Proposal for Concluding Peace Treaty
Pyongyang, November 2 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in an article on its website on October 25 urged the U.S. not to  persistently shun the proposal  for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK.
					 The article said:
					
					 The U.S. is staging large-scale joint naval exercises with the south Korean navy by bringing nuclear carrier Ronald Reagan, cruisers and Aegis destroyers to the waters off Pusan.
					
					 Recently the DPRK set forth an important proposal to defuse the danger of a war and create an environment for lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula by concluding a peace treaty at an early date under the situation where it is impossible to prevent any clash and remove the danger of a new war any longer with the existing Armistice Agreement.
					
					 The protracted efforts for dialogue for the denuclearization of the peninsula failed because of the U.S. ceaseless nuclear blackmail and nuclear war exercises against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should not persist in its reckless nuclear confrontation racket doggedly shunning the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty but face up to the reality and make a decision to respond to it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mesa de alimentos a Kim Chol Man
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mesa de alimentos a Kim Chol Man
Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio una mesa de alimentos a Kim Chol Man, combatiente revolucionario antijapones quien cumple 95 anos de edad.
					Nacido el 2 de noviembre del 9 (1920) de la Era Juche en la familia de campesino arrendatario del distrito de Unhung de la provincia de Ryanggang, el se alisto al Cuerpo Infantil, crecio como miembro del Ejercito Revolucionario Popular de Corea en el regazo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk e hizo aporte a la realizacion de la causa de la liberacion de la patria,.
					
					En la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria realizo proezas heroicas en la lucha contra los agresores norteamericanos y tambien en la posguerra defendio con el fusil de la revolucion el partido y el lider.
					
					Durante ese periodo el Presidente y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il le hicieron conceder la Orden Kim Il Sung, el titulo de doble Heroe de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el de Heroe del Trabajo, los relojes con el nombre del Presidente y la condecoracion del partido y el Estado.
					
					El Mariscal, quien sigue dispensando el amor de los Lideres antecedentes, le hizo otorgar la Orden Kim Jong Il y el reloj con el nombre del Dirigente.
					
					La mesa de alimentos enviada por el Mariscal fue entregada el dia 2 a Kim Chol Man.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin
Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, en relacion con que el accidente de caida de un avion de pasajeros de Rusia ocurrido en Egipto, causo muchas perdidas. 
					El remitente senala que el accidente es gran tristeza para el gobierno y pueblo de Rusia.
					
					Y expresa profunda simpatia y condolencias al destinatario y por su conducto, a las victimas y sus familiares.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al reelecto presidente guineano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al reelecto presidente guineano
Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion al reelecto presidente de la Republica de Guinea, Alpha Conde.
					El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises que tienen una larga historia y tradicion seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose favorablemente tambien en el futuro.
					
					Le desea buena salud y felicidad y exitos en sus labores para lograr la estabilidad politica y la prosperidad economica del pais.

articles.title: Sale delegacion de UJS hacia Cuba y Venezuela
articles.content:
Sale delegacion de UJS hacia Cuba y Venezuela
Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Partio el dia 2 de esta capital la delegacion de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung encabezada por Jong Yong Won, vicepresidente del Comite Central de la UJS, para participar en el XIX Congreso de la Federacion Mundial de la Juventud Democratica que se efectuara en Cuba y visitar a Venezuela.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena disparates anti-RPDC de ministro de Defensa de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena disparates anti-RPDC de ministro de Defensa de Japon
Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el ministro japones de Defensa realizo una visita al Sur de Corea para sostener las conversaciones de autoridades de defensa, ocasion en la cual califico a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de objeto de ejercicio del "derecho a la autodefensa colectiva" y dijo sin vacilacion que no tiene ningun problema en infiltrar en la region nortena de la Peninsula Coreana las "fuerzas armadas de autodefensa" de Japon en el tiempo de emergencia.
					En un comentario divulgado la vispera, el rotativo Minju Joson senala que tales disparates confirmaron que la RPDC ha sido el primer objeto de ataque de los reaccionarios japoneses  que aprobaron la ley de seguridad y extendieron la esfera de cooperacion militar con Estados Unidos en el marco de fortalecimiento de la alianza.
					
					La intencion de los reaccionarios japoneses es realizar a toda costa la ambicion de reagredir a la Peninsula Coreana sumandose a la politica hostil norteamericana sobre la RPDC, apunta el periodico y prosigue:
					
					Ahora en la Peninsula Coreana se aumenta mas la peligrosidad de guerra y choque militar segun la imprudente estrategia de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC, que quiere tomar la hegemonia militar en toda la Peninsula Coreana  presentando la estrategia de dar importancia a Asia-Pacifico.
					
					Los disparates del ministro japones constituyen una muestra de la ambicion de practicar la ley de seguridad.
					
					Esto prueba que todavia no se ha cambiado la ambicion de Japon de ocupar la RPDC y hacerse leon de Asia.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben actuar con prudencia al conocer que la reagresion a la RPDC significa su arruinamiento final.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela objetivo de Japon que niega crimenes del pasado
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela objetivo de Japon que niega crimenes del pasado
Pyongyang, 2 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, la reunion para la solucion del problema de "consoladoras" compuesta con las entidades de mujeres de Japon exigio al premier japones Abe a tomar lo mas pronto posible las medidas porque podria perder la oportunidad de pedir disculpa a las "consoladoras" a causa de que ellas tienen muchas edades.
					Coincidiendo en el tiempo con que en la ONU se elevan las voces de denuncia a la actitud de Japon sobre los crimenes cometidos en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, se celebro en el Estado de New Jersey de Estados Unidos la ceremonia por el V aniversario de la edificacion del monumento en memoria de "consoladoras" del ejercito japones.
					
					Esto deviene el justo enfrentamiento a los reaccionarios japoneses que embellecen a toda costa la historia de agresion de los imperialistas japoneses y sus crimenes antieticos.
					
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 2 y continua:
					
					Hasta la fecha, Japon hace todos los esfuerzos por encubrir sus tremendos crimenes del pasado incluyendo el arresto de muchas mujeres como esclavas sexuales, en vez de pedir disculpas.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses embellecen la historia de agresion del pasado a fin de repetirla. 
					
					El pais isleno aprobo la "ley de seguridad", pese al unanime repudio y rechazo del interior y exterior del pais, lo que demuestra fehacientemente a que grado llega la ambicion de realizar el viejo sueno militarista de tomar la hegemonia mundial bajo el cartel de la "paz del Occidente". 
					
					El primer blanco de la agresion al ultramar de los reaccionarios japoneses es precisamente la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					A fin de lograr su viejo sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" Japon intenta emprender sin vacilacion alguna el camino de agresion a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en contubernio con Estados Unidos bajo el pretexto del "ejercicio del derecho a la autodefensa colectiva".
					
					Si Japon sigue recurriendo a la militarizacion y la nueva agresion camuflando como ahora la historia criminal sin aceptar con sinceridad las lecciones historicas, no podra evitar el arruinamiento.
